sentence.Network_en: And I still don't know how to spell "corporeal."
sentence.Network_cn: 我还不知道怎么写“肉体的”这个词
有体不动产是指土地本身.

sentence.Network_en: He is very religious; corporeal world has little interest for him.
sentence.Network_cn: 他虔信宗教, 对物质上的享受不感兴趣.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'material'): from late Latin corporealis, from Latin corporeus 'bodily, physical', from corpus, corpor- 'body'

entry.def: Corporeal means involving or relating to the physical world rather than the spiritual world.

means.word_mean: 1. having material or physical form or substance;

sentences.sentence: "that which is created is of necessity corporeal and visible and tangible" - Benjamin Jowett

means.word_mean: 2. affecting or characteristic of the body as opposed to the mind or spirit;

auth_sentence.content: Any manner of corporeal presence in the Sacrament.

auth_sentence.content: The full corporeal presence of that massive torso.

auth_sentence.content: Why would it necessarily be the same as our corporeal existence?

stems_affixes.word_buile: corpor身体,团体+ate……的→adj.共同的,团体的
corpor身体,团体+real真的→真的身体→有形的
in无+corporeal[adj.有形的;物质的]→adj.无形体的,非物质的
corpor身体,团体+ation表名词→n.公司,团体
